section.title: Build Requirements
section.p: For building mutt-ng, you need to have the following software installed and working:

ul.li: GNU make. Others won't work as the makefiles use GNU make-only constructs.
A C and C++ compiler. Currently supported are the GNU Compiler Collection and Sun Microsystems' workshop pro compiler suite.
Optionally, for building and running the unit tests, Unit++ (see http://unitpp.sf.net/) must be installed.
Optionally, for building localized versions of the applications, GNU gettext is required to be installed.
Optionally, for encrypted connections, either OpenSSL or GNUTLS is required.
Though technically optional it's higly recommended to have libiconv installed which is used for conversions between different characte sets/encodings.

section.p: For building muttng's homepage as well as the manual, the following tools must be installed and setup properly:
section.ul:
XSL processor. Currently only xsltproc and xalan are supported whereby xalan has problems with XInclude still to be resolved.
DocBook stylesheets for version 4.3.
A LaTeX system including pdflatex, latex and makeindex.
section.p: In addition, for building the source code's documentation, doxygen (see http://www.doxygen.org/) is required.

section.title: Build Configuration
section.p: In the top-level directory, there's a file named configure.pl which configures the build process. Just run it with the preferred set of options, a full list is available when running it with the --help option.

section.title: Building applications
section.p: Building the main applications should be as easy as the following steps:

ol.li:
If it didn't stop with an error (what shouldn't happen), run
$ make depend in the top-level directory.
If everything still succeeded, just run make to build everything.

section.p: If any of these steps fails, please notify the developers via mutt-ng-devel@lists.berlios.de.
